SourceProxy.name: VTKmContour
SourceProxy.label: VTKm Contour

Documentation.long_help: Generate isolines or isosurfaces using point scalars.

SourceProxy.Documentation: The VTKm Marching Cubes filter computes isolines or isosurfaces using a selected point-centered scalar array. It behaves similarly to the standard Contour filter but uses VTKm's finely threaded parallel algorithms.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the input dataset to be used by the contour filter.

StringVectorProperty.label: Contour By
StringVectorProperty.name: SelectInputScalars
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the name of the scalar array from which the contour filter will compute isolines and/or isosurfaces.

DoubleVectorProperty.label: Isosurfaces
DoubleVectorProperty.name: ContourValues
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the values at which to compute isosurfaces/isolines and also the number of such values.

IntVectorProperty.name: ComputeScalars
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: If this property is set to 1, an array of scalars (containing the contour value) will be added to the output dataset. If set to 0, the output will not contain this array.

SourceProxy.name: VTKmThreshold
SourceProxy.label: VTKm Threshold

Documentation.long_help: This filter extracts cells that have point or cell scalars in the specified range.
Documentation.short_help: Extract cells that satisfy a threshold criterion.

SourceProxy.Documentation: The VTKm Threshold filter extracts cells with a field that meets a certain criteria. It behaves similarly to the standard Contour filter but uses VTKm's finely threaded parallel algorithms.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the input to the Threshold filter.

StringVectorProperty.label: Scalars
StringVectorProperty.name: SelectInputScalars
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: The value of this property contains the name of the scalar array from which to perform thresholding.

DoubleVectorProperty.label: Threshold Range
DoubleVectorProperty.name: ThresholdBetween
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: The values of this property specify the upper and lower bounds of the thresholding operation.

SourceProxy.label: VTKm Gradient
SourceProxy.name: VTKmGradient

Documentation.long_help: Estimate the gradient for each point or cell in any type of dataset.
Documentation.short_help: Compute gradients for any type of dataset.

SourceProxy.Documentation: The Gradient filter estimates the gradient vector at each point or cell. It operates on any type of vtkDataSet, and the output is the same type as the input.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the input to the Gradient (Unstructured) filter.

StringVectorProperty.label: Scalar Array
StringVectorProperty.name: SelectInputScalars
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property lists the name of the scalar array from which to compute the gradient.

IntVectorProperty.name: ComputeGradient
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: When this flag is on, the gradient filter will compute the gradient of the input array.

StringVectorProperty.name: ResultArrayName
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property provides a name for the output array containing the gradient vectors.

IntVectorProperty.name: FasterApproximation
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: When this flag is on, the gradient filter will provide a less accurate (but close) algorithm that performs fewer derivative calculations (and is therefore faster). The error contains some smoothing of the output data and some possible errors on the boundary. This parameter has no effect when performing the gradient of cell data or when the input grid is not a vtkUnstructuredGrid.

IntVectorProperty.name: ComputeDivergence
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: When this flag is on, the gradient filter will compute the divergence of a 3 component array.

StringVectorProperty.name: DivergenceArrayName
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property provides a name for the output array containing the divergence vector.

IntVectorProperty.name: ComputeVorticity
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: When this flag is on, the gradient filter will compute the vorticity/curl of a 3 component array.

StringVectorProperty.name: VorticityArrayName
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property provides a name for the output array containing the vorticity vector.

IntVectorProperty.name: ComputeQCriterion
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: When this flag is on, the gradient filter will compute the Q-criterion of a 3 component array.

StringVectorProperty.name: QCriterionArrayName
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property provides a name for the output array containing Q criterion.

SourceProxy.label: VTKm Level Of Detail
SourceProxy.name: VTKmLevelOfDetail

Documentation.long_help: It uses a structured grid of bins and merges all points contained in each bin.

SourceProxy.Documentation: The Level Of Detail filter produces a reduced-resolution polygonal approximation of the input polygonal dataset. This filter is the one used by ParaView for computing LODs. It uses spatial binning to reduce the number of points in the data set; points that lie within the same spatial bin are collapsed into one representative point.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the input to the Quadric Clustering filter.

IntVectorProperty.label: Number of Dimensions
IntVectorProperty.name: NumberOfDivisions
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the number of bins along the X, Y, and Z axes of the data set.

SourceProxy.label: VTKm Cell Data to Point Data
SourceProxy.name: VTKmAverageToPoints

Documentation.long_help: Create point attributes by averaging cell attributes.
Documentation.short_help: Convert cell data to point data.

SourceProxy.Documentation: The Cell Data to Point Data filter averages the values of the cell attributes of the cells surrounding a point to compute point attributes.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the input to the Cell Data to Point Data filter.

StringVectorProperty.name: SelectArray
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the name of the array to averages to cells.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the input to the Clean to Grid filter.

IntVectorProperty.name: CompactPoints
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Remove points that are not part of any cell.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the input to the VTKm Clip filter.

DoubleVectorProperty.name: ClipValue
DoubleVectorProperty.Documentation: The scalar value to use when clipping the dataset. Values greater than ClipValue are preserved in the output dataset.

IntVectorProperty.name: ComputeScalars
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Map all point data arrays onto the output dataset.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the input to the filter.

IntVectorProperty.name: CompactPoints
IntVectorProperty.Documentation: Remove points that are not part of any output cell.

SourceProxy.label: VTKm Point Data to Cell Data
SourceProxy.name: VTKmAverageToCells

Documentation.long_help: Create cell attributes by averaging point attributes.
Documentation.short_help: Convert point data to cell data.

SourceProxy.Documentation: The Point Data to Cell Data filter averages the values of the point attributes of the points defining a cell to compute cell attributes.

InputProperty.name: Input
InputProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the input to the filter.

StringVectorProperty.name: SelectArray
StringVectorProperty.Documentation: This property specifies the name of the array to averages to cells.
